jmplib

Class IntercessorTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • jmplib.IntercessorTransaction

  • public class IntercessorTransaction
extends java.lang.Object
    An intercessor of classes. This class is the façade of JMPlib and provides all the primitive support (add method, replace method, delete method...) and the methods that allow to create invokers for the new members. Contrary to Intercessor, this class supports the execution of several primitives simultaneously as a transaction.
    Author:
    Ignacio Lagartos

    • Method Detail

      • addMethod

        public void addMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.invoke.MethodType methodType,
                      java.lang.String body,
                      java.lang.String... parameterNames)
               throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Adds new method to the specified class.

        For example: 

         // Declaring MethodType
  MethodType mt = MethodType.methodType(int.class, int.class);
  
  // Adding method to Counter
  transaction.addMethod(Counter.class, "sum", mt, 
        "return this.counter += value;", "value");

        This call is equivalent to: 

         transaction.addMethod(Counter.class, "sum", mt, 
        "return this.counter += value;",
        Modifier.PUBLIC, "value");
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the new method
        methodType - The type of the new method
        body - The code of the new method
        parameterNames - Optional parameter unless the method have parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing the adding (e.g. compilation errors)

      • addMethod

        public void addMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.invoke.MethodType methodType,
                      java.lang.String body,

               throws StructuralIntercessionException

        For example: 

         // Declaring MethodType
  MethodType mt = MethodType.methodType(int.class, int.class);
  
  // Adding method to Counter
  transaction.addMethod(Counter.class, "sum", mt, 
        "return this.counter += value;",
        Modifier.PUBLIC, "value");
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the new method
        methodType - The type of the new method
        body - The code of the new method
        modifiers - The modifiers of the new method
        parameterNames - Optional parameter unless the method have parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing the adding (e.g. compilation errors)

      • addMethod

        public void addMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.invoke.MethodType methodType,
                      java.lang.String body,
                      int modifiers,
                      java.lang.Class<?>[] exceptions,
                      java.lang.String... parameterNames)
               throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Adds new method to the specified class.

        For example: 

         // Declaring MethodType
  MethodType mt = MethodType.methodType(int.class, int.class);
  
  Class[] exceptions = new Class[]{IllegalArgumentException.class}; 
  
  // Adding method to Counter
  transaction.addMethod(Counter.class, "sum", mt, 
        "return this.counter += value;",
        Modifier.PUBLIC, exceptions,"value");
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the new method
        methodType - The type of the new method
        body - The code of the new method
        modifiers - The modifiers of the new method
        exceptions - The exceptions that throws the new method
        parameterNames - Optional parameter unless the method have parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing the adding (e.g. compilation errors)

      • replaceImplementation

        public void replaceImplementation(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                  java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String body)
                           throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Replaces the code of one method.

        For example, modifying the method to use a new field called lastResult: 

         // Moify a the method code
 transaction.replaceImplementation(Calculator.class, "sum", 
                "this.lastResult = a + b;" 
                + "return this.lastResult;");
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the method to modify
        body - The new code
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing or the method is overload

      • replaceImplementation

        public void replaceImplementation(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                  java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.invoke.MethodType methodType,
                                  java.lang.String body)
                           throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Replaces the code of one method. The MethodType allows to replace the correct method when the methods are overloaded.

        For example, modifying the method to use a new field called lastResult: 

         // Creating MethodType
 MethodType type = MethodType.methodType(double.class, double.class, double.class);
 
 // Modifiying the method
 transaction.replaceImplementation(Calculator.class, "sum", type, 
                "this.lastResult = a + b;" 
                + "return this.lastResult;");
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the method to modify
        methodType - The type of the method
        body - The new code
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing

      • replaceMethod

        public void replaceMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.invoke.MethodType newMethodType,
                          java.lang.String body)
                   throws StructuralIntercessionException
        Replaces the code and signature of one method.

        For example, modifying the method to acept a more generic type (Dog -> Animal): 

         // Creating MethodType
 MethodType newType = MethodType.methodType(void.class, Pet.class);
 
 // Modifying the method
 transaction.replaceMethod(Owner.class, "addPet", newType, 
                "this.pet = dog;");

        IMPORTANT: the name of the parameters doesn't change.

        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the method
        newMethodType - The new type
        body - The new code
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing or the method is overloaded

      • replaceMethod

        public void replaceMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.invoke.MethodType methodType,
                          java.lang.invoke.MethodType newMethodType,
                          java.lang.String body)
                   throws StructuralIntercessionException
        Replaces the code and signature of one method. The MethodType allows to replace the correct method when the methods are overloaded.

        For example, modifying the method to acept a more generic type (int -> double): 

         // Creating MethodType
 MethodType type = MethodType.methodType(int.class, int.class);
 
 // Creating the new MethodType
 MethodType newType = MethodType.methodType(int.class, double.class);
 
 // Modifying the method
 transaction.replaceMethod(Owner.class, "module10", type, newType, 
                "return number % 10;");

        IMPORTANT: the name of the parameters doesn't change.

        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the method
        methodType - The type of the method to modify
        newMethodType - The new type
        body - The new code
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing

      • deleteMethod

        public void deleteMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                         java.lang.String name)
                  throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Deletes a method from the specified class.

        For example: 

         // Deleting method
 transaction.deleteMethod(Dog.class, "bark");
 
 Dog dog = new Dog();
 dog.bark(); // Throws RuntimeException
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing or the method is overloaded

      • deleteMethod

        public void deleteMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.invoke.MethodType methodType)
                  throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Deletes a method from the specified class. The MethodType allows to delete overloaded methods.

        For example: 

         // Creating MethodType
 MethodType type = MethodType.methodType(int.class, int.class, int.class);
 
 // Deleting method
 transaction.deleteMethod(Calculator.class, "sum", type);
 transaction.commit();
 
 Calculator c = new Calculator();
 int sum = c.sum(1, 1); // Throws RuntimeException
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing

      • addField

        public void addField(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                     java.lang.Class<?> type,
                     java.lang.String name)
              throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Adds a new field to the specified class

        For example: 

         transaction.addField(Person.class, String.class, "lastName");

        This call is equivalent to: 

         transaction.addField(Person.class, 0, String.class, 
                "lastName", null);
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        type - The type of the new field
        name - The name of the new field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing

         transaction.addField(Person.class, Modifier.PRIVATE, String.class,

        type - The type of the new field

        Throws:

        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing

                 throws StructuralIntercessionException

        For example: 

         transaction.deleteField(Person.class, "lastName");
        Parameters:

      • replaceField

        public void replaceField(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.Class<?> newType)
                  throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Replaces the type of one field.

        For example: 

         transaction.replaceField(Calculator.class, "lastResult", double.class);
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the field
        newType - The new type of the field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing

      • replaceField

        public void replaceField(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.Class<?> newType,
                         java.lang.String newInit)
                  throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Replaces the type and the initialization sequence of one field.

        For example: 

         transaction.replaceField(Calculator.class, "lastResult", double.class, "0.0");
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to modify
        name - The name of the field
        newType - The new type of the field
        newInit - The new initialization sequence
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are wrong
        StructuralIntercessionException - If a problem was encountered before finishing

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws StructuralIntercessionException

        Executes all the primitives added. If any error occurr during the process, nothing is going to have effect over the application.

        Throws:
        StructuralIntercessionException
